title: (1993-2022) Comedian Jak Knight Dies at 28
subtitle: A rising talent, he had opened for Dave Chappelle, Hannibal Buress and others

metadata.excerpt: Jak Knight, a stand-up, writer and actor known for his work on ABC’s Black-ish and the Netflix animated series Big Mouth, died by suicide in Los Angeles on July 14, according to a coroner’s report.

components.text: A rising talent, he had opened for Dave Chappelle, Hannibal Buress and others
‘So much of comedy is [being] able to explain life with life experiences’
Jak Knight, a stand-up, writer and actor known for his work on ABC’s Black-ish and the Netflix animated series Big Mouth, died by suicide in Los Angeles on July 14, according to a coroner’s report.

Knight’s death, which stunned friends and collaborators, comes on the heels of a series of professional victories, including the Peacock series Bust Down, which he co-created and starred in, and a Writers Guild of America nomination for the HBO talk show Pause With Sam Jay, which he also co-executive produced.

caption.text: Chris Redd and Jak Knight (right) in Bust Down.

components.text: Chris Redd and Jak Knight (right) in <bold-italic>Bust Down.</bold-italic>
“He had a lot more to say and we’re heartbroken we won’t get to hear it,” tweeted the Hollywood Improv, a club Knight frequented. “We love you forever, Jak.”
If you or someone you know is considering suicide, please contact the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline by dialing 988, text “STRENGTH” to the Crisis Text Line at 741741 or go to 988lifeline.org.

“Rest in peace, Jak Knight. Hilarious comedian and a great guy. I can’t believe it.”
—Kumail Nanjiani

“There was no one like Jak Knight. A singular talent, actually funny and a genuinely kind person, a rare combo.”
—Joel Kim Booster

“This is how I’ll always remember my friend Jak Knight: laughing and making us laugh.”
—Big Mouth co-creator Andrew Goldberg
FILMMAGIC; ALLEN BEREZOVSKY/GETTY IMAGES; GREGG DEGUIRE/FILMMAGIC; INVISION/AP/SHUTTERSTOCK; PEACOCK
